headline.main: CELEBRATION AT STONY POINT.; SPEECHES OF BENJ. F. BUTLER AND OTHERS JUDGE AMASA J.PARKER'S ADDRESS. A MONUMENT TO BE ERECTED.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thursday was a great day at Stony Point. The citizens of Rockland County and the adjacent country, assembled in great force to witness the lay ing of the corner-stone of a monument to be erected to the memory of the heroic WAYNE and his com rades, who, on the memorable 15th of July, 1779, stormed the fortress that at that time crowned theheight, and killed or took prisoner the entire British

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; D'Orsay, the Murderer, who is to be Hanged To-Day-Antonio Francis, of the Franklin Pierce Murder. THE MUDEREERS IN THE TOMBS. The "Morning Star"

docs.lead_paragraph: It appears not to be generally understood, that at or about 10 o'clock this morning, an athletic negro born in St. Domingo, and known as JOHN D'OESAY, will be choked to death within the limits of the City Prison, in accordance with the law in such cases made and provided. This D'ORSAY murdered a woman in Worthstreet some months since. .

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The School Teachers to Thalberg and D'Angrl. CONCERNING WASHINGTON MARKET. MECHANICS' INSTITUTE. CHARGE OF FORGERY. MYSTERIOUS DISAPPEARANCE RESISTANCE TO OFFICERS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last evening there was a curious reunion at the St. Nicholas. In token of their thanks for the Matinsee which Mr. THALBERG and Mme. D'ANGRI have given, the public school teachers of the City presented to both these artists a testimonial in the shape of parchments, with elaborately penned compliments, both verbal and pictorial. The following is their inseriptions:

docs.lead_paragraph: 1 THE BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH--BRIBERY CASE--AN ALDERMAN EXPELLED.--The Brooklyn Common Council held a special meeting Wednesday evening, (President PIERSON in the Chair,) to continue the bearing of the case of Alderman PRESTON. HENRY L.

docs.lead_paragraph: All the emigrant passengers from the ship Ellen Austin and Albert Gallatin, (about even hundred,) were landed yesterday at the old Quarantine. They laid off upon the green lawns of the Marine Hospital, and enjoyed themselves finely. The Physician and his employes are kept very busy in providing temporary accommodations for this large number.

docs.lead_paragraph: The above Board met on Wednesday noon at the City Hall. The President, JONAS N. PHILIPS, in the Chair. After the adoption of the minutes of the previous meeting, the following communication was received and read from ROBERT MUNROE HARRISON, Esq., United States Consul at Kingston, Jamaica, respecting the Yellow Fever at that port:

docs.lead_paragraph: Brooklyn Board of Health. A meeting of this Board was held last evening, Present--Mayor PEWELL, (presiding,) and Alderman, Pierson, Schols and Fithian, and Dr. Cleveland, Health Officer. A number of cow-stables and vacant lots in the Eighteenth Ward were reported nuisances, and the usual order made.
